intro: Coris monspeliensis var. fontqueri, commonly known as the Fontqueri's coris, is a rare and distinctive plant native to specific regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, often in mountainous or coastal areas. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are small and white, arranged in compound umbels. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
